8.26.22  12:48 am   How do you casually ask for someone's phone number?

      you could add a box for it, but with no star. make it not one of the *required fields

8.25.22  11:39 pm   I've been planing to make a music video but every time I watch myself on playback I see myself as ugly but people keep telling me I'm not but I think they're just trying to be nice. What do I do?

      whether you are ugly or not, you're going to have to stop thinking about it, in order to get good results. if you must assume you are ugly, that's fine, you can assume this, but then go ahead and move forward and do the performances anyway. actually pretend you are even uglier. that will force your performances to be even stronger

If you were to compare this general vibe to a flavor, what would it be?

      i'd say "halftime" but i'm not sure if you're talking about the middle or the ending of the ending

8.25.22  9:47 am   what are the key signatures in your new song?

      A major, and probably G major. the key changes a lot more than that, but most of the other changes are too fleeting to require a key signature change

8.25.22  8:45 am   have you ever invented a new color or do you paln to do it in the future

      i don't really know how to do that. but sometimes i find a color that i don't remember using, so that's pretty fun for me

8.25.22  7:29 am   whenever i'm in school i'll come up with crazy melodies and harmonies in my head but when i sit in fromt of my piano, nothing comes out. sometimes i can't even write my ideas down because they fade away so quickly. what should i do??

      keep doing all this and eventually you'll find common ground. like dreams, the ideas want to come to you when you're not trying. that's why you freeze up when you are actually 'supposed to' have an idea. and why the ideas come so easily when it doesn't matter. these 2 opposing worlds (in-the-office, out-of-the-office) will probably always be disconnected like this. but the more you do both, the better you will get at both. for out-of-the-office, i think the game of capturing can always be improved. most of the time you are feeling like you are unable to capture it completely. because, like dreams, the best ideas probably happen when you are entirely not trying, and entirely not thinking nor worried. and as soon as you start worrying about capturing it, that will begin to degrade the idea. but i'd say over time you can just about get the hang of it with minimal degradation. And for the in-the-office experience, there are hopefully some things you can do to settle in and get more comfortable. I'd recommend starting out by playing/writing bad things on purpose, to try to take the pressure off. play at least enough to forget you're there. that should hopefully put you back in the proper carefree state

8.25.22  7:10 am   opinion on backpacks and or soda bottles?

      i have a trick to remember which is which

8.25.22  7:08 am   There's so much to do and so little time, how do I begin?

      make a list of things you will not do, no matter how much time you have

      to get it out of my system

      the sweet spot is following it halfway

      i'll see if i can come up with something

      sure

      no one thinks that

8.24.22  9:29 pm   Why is the sky blue

      to calm you down

8.24.22  9:10 pm   Being a independent artist, how to you keep yourself productive on a regular basis?

8.24.22  8:42 pm   ok so, are you taking another break

     i generally manage to take a few days break every 3 weeks

     the title "the ending" seems eerily similar to "might quit" 

     the spelling is different

8.24.22  8:32 pm   how did your new song "the ending" start off? when did you start writing it, how'd it come about? 

      during the selection process this time, i accidentally came up with i something brand new which unexpectedly bypassed the entire selection process and was selected on the spot. no lyric, though, so, .... first thing was to begin searching for what lyric belongs on it. unfortunately, i think the pressure of liking the melody too much got to me and for some reason i was stuck on that for at least 2 days. i eventually got something that seemed to work, but it was not as title-worthy and iconic as i was hoping for. so in that case, i adopted more of a "just did a bad thing" strategy and just moved forward quickly. the "not worthy" part was also shocking to me, because it uses language and themes that i just absolutely don't recognize as my own. but that's actually fun when this happens because then the parts that come next will tend to have a "what the heck?" aspect to them, as they try to explain how the heck we got into this mess. turns into kind of an adventure story

8.24.22  8:17 pm   is "the ending" about someone a kid who doesn't really value school/think it serves them well, learning about music for the first time?

     i could see how that could fit

     is it...about you?

     the melody of the verse is about me. not really the lyrics, but the melody is. it's doing a lot of half-bar fakeouts with the chord changes. i adore this and will do it for the rest of my life if i can. Also, the middle section where it goes "it's not true, it's not true", that part does seem to be about me. Whether i like to admit it, i've noticed over the years that i just really seem to enjoy saying "that's not true". and that's probably the reason this section exists. The other line that's pretty much about me is "put it in my musical". Generally, i've come to realize that one of the most promising and useful ways i could express any idea i may have, is to "put it in a musical", which can more broadly refer to most of the kind of audio/visual content i've released so far

8.24.22  7:48 pm   how do I arrive at words that mean something but don't make me feel naked? or is naked just part of it?

      maybe that's just one step toward the process of finding the better clothes you've actually been craving but don't know about yet
